attributes.action: remove the additional time added on to secondary school days
attributes.additional_details:
Because there is many children who are struggling enough to get home on time and end up having no time to theirselves after school to enjoy due to the large amount of homework 
The additional time added on will yet further take a toll on a students mental health state.
attributes.background: To remove the additional time that has been added on to the secondary school days as it will take an impact on students lives.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action. We understand that you're concerned about changes to the length of the school day, but we're not sure exactly what you want the Government to do.

The Government has said that it expects all state-funded mainstream schools to deliver a school week of at least 32.5 hours by September 2023 at the latest, but decisions about the length of the school day are a matter for individual schools.

We could accept a petition calling on the Government to revoke its expectation that schools deliver a school week of at least 32.5 hours.

We could also accept a petition calling on the Government to limit schools to certain hours, but it would need to be clear what limits you wanted the Government to impose.
